REQUEST FOR AMENDMENT AND EXTENSION OP THE PROJECT
Under this contract, the NAEB is preparing and producing six "hits'* of infor¬
mation about the utilization of television lessons in the classrocm. Each
kit vill contain a 30-minute l6mm sound film together with correlated materials
such as discussion outlines, bibliographies, and general background information.
The kits are designed to provide the basis for a meeting or class session
relating to some phase of utilization.
The kits are being prepared in such a way that they can be used in seg.uence
or individually for special interest meetings. They will be particularly
appropriate for seminars and summer workshops in educational television.
CURRENT STATUS OF THE PROJECT
The NAEB was awarded a contract to produce these materials on January 30>
1963* As a result of the first Advisory Committee meeting, specific outlines
were developed and an agreement was made to secure the services of a writer
who could develop these outlines into script treatments. As the treatments
were prepared and reviewed by the Committee, it became apparent that the use
of video tape and kinescope film for the production of these materials as
originally contemplated, would not provide a satisfactory technical process
for the production of superior materials.
Therefore, at the reg.uest of the Advisory Committee, the Project Staff was
directed to discuss with the U.S. Office of Education, an amendment to the
contract which would provide additional fimds to produce these materials
directly on film. The discussions between the National Association of Educa¬
tional Broadcasters and the Office of Education were conducted during a four
month period and resulted in an amendment to the contract dated September 15^
1963, calling for film production, although it was acknowledged that this
would most likely require a lengthier production schedule than videotape
and kinescope.
